snippet: More households are being priced out of more areas: An analysis found 90 cities where the median rent is more than 30 percent of the median gross income.
abstract: More middle-income families are being priced out of many cities as tightening market pushes up rents ever faster, outrunning modest rises in pay; Zillow finds 90 cities where median rent--not including utilities--is more than 30 percent of median gross income; half of all renters are spending more than 30 percent of income on housing.
lead_paragraph: More households are being priced out of more areas: An analysis found 90 cities where the median rent is more than 30 percent of the median gross income.

headline.main: In Many Cities, Rent Is Rising Out of Reach of Middle Class
headline.print_headline: In Many Cities, Rent Is Rising Out of Reach of Middle Class
